result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Kardash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Mental Health with any treatment deemed appropriate. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Undergo random urine screens.

No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.  No contact with AMH.  No pictures over any electronic device sent to anyone.  No electronic communication with anyone under the age of 18.
Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.  Obtain/maintain employment if not in school.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court informed defendant he may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and no sanctions.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed to be used by the agent for any sanctions:  the 1st violation will be 10 days in the House of Correction; the 2nd will be 30 days; the 3rd will be 60 days and the 4th will be the balance, if not revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Kardash

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used by the agent for any sanctions:  the 1st violation will be 10 days in the House of Correction; the 2nd will be 30 days; the 3rd will be 60 days and the 4th will be the balance, if not revoked.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Mental Health with any treatment deemed appropriate.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.
- Obtain/maintain employment if not in school.
- No contact with AMH.
- No pictures over any electronic device sent to anyone.
- No electronic communication with anyone under the age of 18.
- Perform 50 hours of community service.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court informed defendant he may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and no sanctions.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

AS TO AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case adjourned to 6-6-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Exposing a Child to Harmful Material (Possession), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.11(2)(b), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-05-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 10 on 04-25-2014 at 08:30 am. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an addtional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M.H.   AND/OR  her residence   AND/OR  her family    AND/OR  her place of school

Defendant Richard A Kardash in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #14-033

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/18/14 @ 1:30pm
